definition: to put effort into (work, farming, writing etc)/a masterpiece
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Guillotine is a masterpiece of Aitmatov in 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 《斷頭臺》是艾特瑪托夫八十年代的力作。

sentences.english: Expect another tightly plotted film from Hong Kong's master of stylish thrillers.
sentences.chinese: 期待香港這位驚悚片大師又一部扣人心絃的力作吧。

sentences.english: Shimaoshizhuanshu is a book on which Chen Huan spent his lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 《詩毛氏傳疏》是陳奐花費畢生精力而成的一部力作。

sentences.english: Shuting's love poetry is significant works in the history of Chinese love poetry.
sentences.chinese: 舒婷的愛情詩是中國愛情詩史上不可或缺的力作。

sentences.english: Compliance is the dilating extent of elastic tissue below pressure.
sentences.chinese: 順應性是指外力作用下彈性組織的可擴張性。

sentences.english: Brazil nut if does not have the exogenic process, the seed can in the shell rotten.
sentences.chinese: 巴西堅果如果沒有外力作用，種子就會在殼內腐爛。

sentences.english: Two Photographers will showcase the recent works of Li Gang and Zhou Jun.
sentences.chinese: 兩個攝影師將會呈獻李剛和周軍的最新力作。

sentences.english: Star Lake Island, Yangcheng Lake hairy crabs license sales masterpiece Shanghai, facing the country.
sentences.chinese: 星湖島牌陽澄湖大閘蟹銷售力作上海，面向全國。

sentences.english: “It’s a forward-looking effort to update Internet privacy law, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: 這是更新互聯網隱私法律的前瞻性力作。

sentences.english: It’ll be Burton’s next project after Alice in Wonderland.
sentences.chinese: 這將是伯頓繼《愛麗絲夢遊仙境》後的又一部力作。

sentences.english: Excellent realism high-quality goods, the play center success transational university-in new face.
sentences.chinese: 優秀的現實主義，打中鋒的精品力作轉製成功新面貌。

sentences.english: Lord of the Flies is a masterpiece condemning the evilness of humanity.
sentences.chinese: 《蠅王》是一部批判人性惡的力作。

sentences.english: The stain "is" cover "martial peace again after feature-length works.
sentences.chinese: 《污點》是武和平《袒護》之後又一部長篇力作。

sentences.english: Money Never Sleeps slaps his oeuvre back to life.
sentences.chinese: 《金錢永不眠》又將成爲他的力作之一。

definition: to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
representative work (of an author or artist)
to hit the market (of a new product)
to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
